Description: Three non-joining rim fragments of Ionian pottery rosette bowl; interior glazed with traces of one or possibly two narrow bands in added red; exterior: four dotted rosettes beneath rim; black around handle roots; black vertical line below one handle; below, traces of at least two bands in dilute.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Personal note from J.M. Cook in 1972 giving brief description and date (600BC or early 6th century). J. M. Cook 1972
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.173)
